hypothesis_content.title: BTC Momentum Reversal After 3-Day Consolidation
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC enters a 3-day consolidation period (daily range < 2% each day) within a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout in the direction of the pre-consolidation trend will generate momentum that persists for at least 2 days with >1.5x average daily volume.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Consolidation periods in neutral regimes often represent accumulation/distribution before continuation. The 3-day filter reduces noise while the volume confirmation validates institutional participation in the breakout.
entry_conditions: BTC daily range < 2% for 3 consecutive days
Pre-consolidation 5-day trend direction is clear (slope > 0.3% daily for uptrend, < -0.3% for downtrend)
Breakout candle closes beyond consolidation range with volume > 1.5x 20-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% move from entry in breakout direction
exit_conditions.time_exit: 48 hours after entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 50% of such breakouts fail to reach 3% continuation within 48 hours across 100+ historical instances.
